group_1.textRight: It took you no effort to break through.

group_1.textLeft: It was just a wooden door, not a steel one…
At any rate, we need to escape and find@Sasha and Urara.

group_1.textCenter: …So you were capable of breaking it down@after all.

group_1.textRight: Greetings.
…This place was once an armory.
We turned it into a makeshift prison,@so the construction is pretty simple…
But it's still not something us ordinary women@and children can break through so easily.
Right… I can tell by looking that you're not one@of the Mongols.
More precisely, there's a low chance you are,@considering you know our language.
Nevertheless, amidst the presence of Mongolian soldiers, you came here alone…
…You're a Rakshasi, aren't you?
Why…? What?
…Aren't you a Junior Nun from elsewhere?
Huh…so you aren't, huh…?
…Well, it'll be easier if I let you see for yourself.
[bgEffect:shakeSmall]Yah!

group_1.textLeft: Not like that! You need to hold the arrow@steadily until you release it!

group_1.textRight: [live2dName:live2d_2:effect_emotion_sad_0][se:7224_fall_into]Ugh… It's so haaard…
One of our training drills…@We do these exercises every day.
Here, let me show you another thing.
We also patrol around town and mediate@any troubles.
Honestly, we've become less of a nunnery@and more of a vigilante group.

group_1.textCenter: Alright, now apologize to each other!@[chara:833900:lipSynch_0][wait:1.2][chara:833900:effect_emotion_joy_0][se:7222_happy][chara:833900:lipSynch_1]Yes, that settles that!

group_1.textRight: We can get these things settled in no time.
After all, everyone in town thinks that if they@go against us, they'll get what they deserve.

group_1.textLeft: (So the people in town consider them@extraordinary beings…?)

group_1.textCenter: You see, "Rakshasi" is the word for "savior."
They are the ones who will destroy the evil@Mongols and bring Shambhala to this land.
But in Mongolia, they see Rakshasi differently.
To them, the word is used in the sense@of "Rakshasa," or "evil demon."

group_1.textRight: We have classroom lessons, too.@This Junior Nun takes the role of a teacher.
It's for girls like me.
We're like apprentice monks, though we don't@have to obey any precepts.
Curious… There's no record of these@"Junior Nuns" in Iroha's record.

group_1.textLeft: Could it be that this isn't actually the nunnery@she'd been observing from above…?

group_1.textRight: Or perhaps…there is a chance that we have@deviated from the proper course of history.
Hey, hey, how do you know the Mongolian@language?

group_1.textLeft: I asked Heruka. She's been studying the@language or something.

group_1.textRight: Ah, yeah, Heruka's always got her nose@in reading material.
…And that's how we spend our days here.

group_1.textLeft: In preparation for war with the Mongols…?

group_1.textRight: More like…preparing to become Rakshasi@so we can fight the Mongols.

group_1.narration: "We've been taught that if we train enough,@then High Priest Jataka will choose us to become@Rakshasis who hold the power of the Buddha…@and so we keep on training."
"Admittedly, none of us really knows anything@about Lord Jataka. The adults were ignorant, too…@I don't know if we truly can become Rakshasis."

group_1.textLeft: The adults… Come to think of it, there weren't@any in the nunnery. Did they all flee?

group_1.textRight: We exiled them because they tried to put@an end to the Rakshasi ceremony.

group_1.narration: "There were other nunneries, not just this one,@that would select their own Rakshasi…"
"All of them except ours fell to@the Mongols… Although the Rakshasi fought,@they were still no match for them."

"The Lama, the leader of the monks,@was terrified after learning the other nunneries@were being sacked one after another,@and that the Rakshasis had lost to the Mongols.@So he declared that we wouldn't fight them."
"Rather than conducting the Rakshasi ceremony,@he urged us all to flee."

group_1.textRight: In response, I took action and expelled him@and the other priests.

group_1.narration: "Of course, I didn't do it alone.@There were other girls who agreed with me.@Most of us have lost our homes to the Mongols,@so we had some good numbers…and were able@to throw out the adults."

group_1.textLeft: …So you're saying that you and the others@are training to take revenge,
to become Rakshasi with the power@to defeat the Mongols…

group_1.textRight: Everyone else might be like that…@but I just want to keep Heruka safe.
…Hey, maybe you can help me protect her, too!
